response_parsed.title: _codecs_hk Standard Library Module in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This explainer delves into the _codecs_hk module, a valuable addition to Python 3.12+ that expands support for traditional Chinese encoding schemes and simplified Chinese encoding schemes.

key_points.point: Extends support for traditional Chinese (Big5, Big5-HKSCS, and CNS11643)
key_points.explanation: Previously, Python had limited support for traditional Chinese encodings. The _codecs_hk module addresses this gap by offering built-in decoders and encoders for these encoding schemes.

key_points.point: Improves support for simplified Chinese (GBK, GB18030)
key_points.explanation: The _codecs_hk module enhances Python's support for simplified Chinese encodings by providing built-in decoders and encoders for GBK and GB18030.
The _codecs_hk module can be used instead of the standard _codecs module, as it provides all the functionalities of the latter with added support for traditional and simplified Chinese encodings.

key_points.point: Enables seamless interaction with Chinese-language systems
key_points.explanation: By extending Python's capabilities for handling Chinese encoding schemes, _codecs_hk enables developers to work more effectively with Chinese-language applications and systems.

code_examples.code:
import codecs

# Traditional Chinese (Big5) encoding
text = '你好'.encode('big5')
decoded_text = codecs.decode(text, 'big5', 'ignore')
print(decoded_text)

import _codecs_hk

# Traditional Chinese (Big5) encoding with _codecs_hk
text = '你好'.encode('big5')
decoded_text = _codecs_hk.decode(text, 'big5', 'ignore')
print(decoded_text)

caveats.caveat: Limited support for some less common Chinese encoding schemes may still be absent.
caveats.recommendation: For these cases, third-party libraries like chardet or iconv may provide additional support.
